document_data.caption: ''Teela, coiled around Kagha's feet.''
document_data.name: Teela
document_data.mainbody:
'''Teela''' was a [[viper]] and a companion of the [[druid]] [[Kagha]].

{{Quote|A new hatchling. Yes. They can be foolish.|Teela, when speaking of children.}}
document_data.Abilities:
Teela could readily communicate with Kagha. It was unknown if this originated from Kagha's druidic powers, or a special bond held by the pair.

A single bite from Teela could prove deadly to smaller individuals, such as children.
document_data.Activities: Teela gladly served at Kagha's beck and call, specifically when she sought to threaten and intimidate others.
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Kagha took over leadership of the [[Emerald Grove]] when her superior, [[archdruid]] [[Halsin]], went away on trek to uncover more about goings-on in the region. After a community of [[tiefling]] refugees from [[Elturel]] had been granted refuge in the grove by Halsin, and a child named [[Arabella]] from among their ranks attempted to steal the ''[[Idol of Silvanus]]'' from the druids.

Kagha used Teela to frighten the child into confessing her crime and had the viper remained poised to strike, and execute her brand of justice.
